articles.headline: Melinda French Gates to Resign From Gates Foundation
articles.snippet: The co-founder of the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation will chart her own course as a philanthropist focused on women’s rights and gender equality.
articles.abstract: The co-founder of the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation will chart her own course as a philanthropist focused on women’s rights and gender equality.
articles.lead_paragraph: Melinda French Gates is leaving the behemoth foundation she and her former husband, Bill Gates, founded nearly a quarter-century ago to devote herself fully to her work on behalf of women and girls, which has been the focus of much of her recent philanthropy.
articles.byline: By Anupreeta Das and Santul Nerkar

articles.headline: What Forecasters Say About Interest Rates (and Why They Disagree)
articles.snippet: Hopes for a steep drop in borrowing costs for consumers and businesses have been dashed. But some experts predict modest reductions in coming months.
articles.abstract: Hopes for a steep drop in borrowing costs for consumers and businesses have been dashed. But some experts predict modest reductions in coming months.
articles.lead_paragraph: How soon is soon? Or exactly how much later is later?

articles.headline: High Interest Rates Are Hitting Poorer Americans the Hardest
articles.snippet: The economy as a whole has proved resilient amid the highest rates in decades. But beneath the surface, many low- and moderate-income families are struggling.
articles.abstract: The economy as a whole has proved resilient amid the highest rates in decades. But beneath the surface, many low- and moderate-income families are struggling.
articles.lead_paragraph: High interest rates haven’t crashed the financial system, set off a wave of bankruptcies or caused the recession that many economists feared.
articles.byline: By Ben Casselman and Jeanna Smialek

articles.headline: R.F.K. Jr. Is 2024’s X Factor, New Polls Show, Fueled by Young Voters and Social Media
articles.snippet: Half of Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s supporters said they were voting chiefly for him, and nearly half said their support was mostly a vote against President Biden or former President Donald J. Trump.
articles.abstract: Half of Robert F. Kennedy Jr.’s supporters said they were voting chiefly for him, and nearly half said their support was mostly a vote against President Biden or former President Donald J. Trump.
articles.lead_paragraph: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. is polling stronger than any third-party candidate has in decades, pulling in roughly 10 percent of registered voters across the battleground states as he saps support from both President Biden and former President Donald J. Trump, a new series of polls has found.
articles.byline: By Shane Goldmacher and Neil Vigdor

articles.headline: How China Rose to Lead the World in Cars and Solar Panels
articles.snippet: Heavy subsidies for industry, together with weak sales in China, have set the stage for an export boom, raising fears of factory job losses elsewhere.
articles.abstract: Heavy subsidies for industry, together with weak sales in China, have set the stage for an export boom, raising fears of factory job losses elsewhere.
articles.lead_paragraph: For decades, China has moved methodically to dominate ever more industries, from toys and clothing in the 1980s to semiconductors and renewable energy today. China now produces a third of the world’s manufactured goods — more than the United States, Germany, Japan, South Korea and Britain combined. Its trade surplus in these goods is equal to a tenth of the entire Chinese economy.

articles.headline: Biden Hits Chinese Electric Vehicles, Chips and Other Goods With Higher Tariffs
articles.snippet: The president announced increased taxes on Chinese imports in strategic industries, building on former President Donald J. Trump’s tariffs.
articles.abstract: The president announced increased taxes on Chinese imports in strategic industries, building on former President Donald J. Trump’s tariffs.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Biden on Tuesday announced a sharp increase in tariffs on an array of Chinese imports, including electric vehicles, solar cells, semiconductors and advanced batteries, in an effort to protect strategic American industries from a new wave of competitors that he said were unfairly subsidized by Beijing.
articles.byline: By Jim Tankersley and Alan Rappeport

articles.headline: Israeli Military Leaders See Danger in Lack of a Plan to Govern Gaza
articles.snippet: As Hamas reappears in places Israel’s troops had cleared, Israeli commanders say their government’s failure to plan for stabilizing and administering Gaza will leave a perilous power vacuum.
articles.abstract: As Hamas reappears in places Israel’s troops had cleared, Israeli commanders say their government’s failure to plan for stabilizing and administering Gaza will leave a perilous power vacuum.
articles.lead_paragraph: With Israeli troops returning to clear Hamas for the second or third time from parts of northern Gaza, and fighting farther south in Rafah, too, Israel’s government has found itself confronting more vocal discontent from an important constituency: its own military leaders.
articles.byline: By Damien Cave and Adam Rasgon

articles.headline: A.I.’s ‘Her’ Era Has Arrived
articles.snippet: New chatbot technology can talk, laugh and sing like a human. What comes next is anyone’s guess.
articles.abstract: New chatbot technology can talk, laugh and sing like a human. What comes next is anyone’s guess.
articles.lead_paragraph: A lifelike artificial intelligence with a smooth, alluring voice enchants and impresses its human users — flirting, telling jokes, fulfilling their desires and eventually winning them over.
